base-item.title: Base Item
base-item.description: Choose the base item for your custom item. Use the dropdown to select the item you want to use if you want to keep right-click functionality. Otherwise, use Override Item to create a custom item that isn't capable of being right-clicked, but it can be any item you want.

item-name.title: Item Name
item-name.description: Set the name of your item in the text box. Use the checkboxes and color dropdown to customize the look of the text.

item-description.title: Item Description
item-description.description: Set the description of your item in the text box. Use the checkboxes and color dropdown to customize the look of the text.

on-right-click.title: On Right-Click
on-right-click.description:
Choose what happens when the player right clicks with the item held.

None: Disables right-click functionality
Run Function: Runs a function that you need to write yourself
Run Commands: Define several commands to run when the item is right-clicked

on-hit.title: On Hit
on-hit.description:
Choose what happens when the item is used to hit an entity.

On Victim: Run the command as the entity that got hit
On Attacker: Run the command as the entity that hit the other entity

Do Nothing: No commands are executed when an entity is hit
Run Function: Runs a function that you need to write yourself
Run Commands: Define several commands to run when the item is used to hit an entity

on-kill.title: On Kill
on-kill.description:
Choose what happens when the item is used to kill an entity.

On Victim: Run the command as the entity that died
On Attacker: Run the command as the entity that killed the other entity

Do Nothing: No commands are executed when an entity is killed
Run Function: Runs a function that you need to write yourself
Run Commands: Define several commands to run when the item is used to hit an entity

attribute.title: Attributes
attribute.description: Set various miscellaneous option for your custom item. Select an attibute from the dropdown and use the '+' button to add it to your item. Use the '-' button to remove it. Each attribute has a description that will appear when you hover over it.

damage.title: Damage
damage.description: The amount of damage added on to a fully charged attack. Most items have 1 by default, and tools have more. A diamond sword has 7.

attack-speed.title: Attack Speed
attack-speed.description: The amount of times per second an attack can be fully charged. Most items have 4 by default, and tools have less. A diamond sword has 1.4.

unbreakable.title: Unbreakable
unbreakable.description: Set wether the item can loose durability or not.

custom-model-data.title: Custom Model Data
custom-model-data.description: Set the custom model data of the item. This is useful if you are using a resourcepack to change the appearance of the item. Specifying this value will cause the item to use the texture specified with the same number in your resourcepack

durability-max.title: Max Durability
durability-max.description: Set the amount of durability taken from its maximum.
